page.title: 09British Telecom, Bromley
page.content:
British Telecom, London South East is one of 11 areas in London. It covers an area of 144.36 square miles and has its headquarters in central Bromley.
In 1983-4, the revenue collected was 88.5 million pounds. The area employs 3320 staff: 1658 engineers, 684 operators and supervisors, 291 managers and 687 clerical and ancillary staff.
There are 52 exchanges supplying 383,325 lines and 477,575 working stations in 1985. Of these exchanges, 14 have electronic, 11 crossbar and 27 Strowger types of equipment. All exchanges have subscriber trunk dialling and international direct dialling facilities.
87% of all households in the area have at least one telephone.
